title: Silence: The Language That Speaks Volumes
description: A fast breakdown of Silence: The Language That Speaks Volumes for builders.

hook.text: In Finland, two minutes of silence in a meeting is normal. In Brazil, two seconds of silence is unbearable.

buildup.text: Silence means different things: respect (Japan), discomfort (US), contemplation (Finland), agreement (some Arab.

discovery.text: Western cultures fill silence because it signals disconnect. Many Eastern cultures use silence because it signals.

twist.text: Americans speak within 0.2 seconds of a pause. Japanese wait up to 8 seconds.
